**"The Copper Talisman and Iron Scroll: Master Formula of the Three Primordial Elixirs**

When the Jade Purity bestows the decree of immortal office,
It governs the Southern Cauldron, mastering the transformation of all things.
The crimson script is profound and hidden in Pengyi’s chamber,
The dark arts are most forbidden beneath the azure sky’s verdant expanse.

Eight myriads, four thousand—one kalpa’s legacy—
Passed down through celestial talismans, inscribed by the Fire Record’s chronicle.
In the year of *Gēng-Jiǎ* (庚甲), chaotic *qi* dissolves,
As myriad heavenly assemblies rejoice in their grand celestial halls.

Prostrating in reverence before the Great Dao,
Ten thousand sages and true ones abide in profound stillness.
Gazing afar upon the Crystal Terrace, guests of Jade Purity,
The brows remain unfurrowed, yet the heart is heavy with concealed sorrow.

After long deliberation, the Nine-Six Gates are raised,
And the crane’s flight is heard as it seeks the turtle’s upward gaze.
The Great Dao spreads, filling the heavens above,
Your ranks of immortals rejoice without bound.

When the Three Kalpas of the Dragon and Han dynasties conclude,
The Mystic Palace unfolds its vast and auspicious domain.
The Eastern and Western Hua ascend in turn,
The Grand Sovereign of the Great Unity, *Zhēn Mǔ* (谌母), is transmitted.

Receiving the august decree of the Second Eight,
Most profound, most wondrous, most subtle and hidden.
It can make the dusty world flow with jade nectar,
And swiftly summon the immortal to the Celestial Pool.

The Pearl Terrace descends the Copper Talisman and Iron Scroll,
Imperially bestowed to *Zhēn Mǔ* (谌母) for her knowledge.
The Great Dao’s True Person expounds the Dao’s immortal secrets,
Interpreting the orthodox teachings: mercury and lead in harmony.

Lead ascends like snow-waves, pearls roll in flight,
Yet when lowered, it rests as true earth in slumber.
Earth, in response to the talisman’s decree, bears emerald leaves,
Each blossom a golden flower, rising in purple mist.

The purple mist ascends to the Lingxiao Hall,
Continuously linked, like scattered petals of water.
The sun and moon cast their radiant light upon the Great Thousand,
The *Xùn* (巽) wind blows, revealing golden flowers.

Without the rolling pearls, one cannot measure the lead,
As living beings gather their essence to ward off perilous battles.
The solar spirit is about to depart, the lunar deity is full,
Resplendent solar spirits, nine myriads in glory.

The four quarters are enveloped by the True Lead’s fusion,
Lead containing five colors—who could ever perceive?
Refining lead without measuring the True Transmission,
One cannot find *Gēng Jīn Huà* (庚金华) without obstruction.

Harvesting the True Lead of *Xīn Jīn* (辛金), a single essence,
Then returning to the Ash Pool for further purification.
Ascending and descending in tumultuous flux,
Do not let the *Rén Huā* (壬花) be disordered by black clouds.

Extracting the celestial spirit, seizing the solar mist,
Within the Water Crystal Palace—there lies my true abode.
Retrieving the rolling gold to restore the sacred form,
Why toil endlessly across the vast expanse of the world?

Mercury dies, becoming lead, which then transforms into earth,
The white gold vessel—the ancestor of the elixir’s foundation.
Exhausting the celestial spirit and terrestrial essence,
The Primordial Origin calls this the *Dān Mǔ* (丹母).

Mercury accumulates ninety-nine times, returning as sand,
The Dragon emerges from the east, the Tiger from the west.
In the Jin dynasty, the enlightened king preserved filial virtue,
His golden sinews and jade bones granted to his descendants.

The incantation commands the water to subdue the demonic leader,
His manifest and covert virtues benefit all under heaven.
Take the Iron Scroll’s decree of the Heavenly King,
And the Copper Talisman’s subtle secrets, passed orally to you.

The Jade Purity wishes to see the virtuous and meritorious,
His broad brows unfurl, his face bright with joy.
The Great Obstruction is sealed within a jade casket,
A radiant pearl shatters the world, revealing its hidden citadel.

Swiftly seize the famous mountain’s jade hare,
Dazzling the sun, capturing it—no further debate.
When the solar spirit is exhausted, the thousand mountains turn white,
Why fret over trifles when the body is already shadowed?

Simply boil millet to nourish the spirit-*qi*,
Observing the celestial timing, leaning toward the Five Tombs.

The malevolent dragon spews forth the Three Rivers’ waters,
Its venomous *qi* scatters, staining the world’s dust.
If you do not command it to aid in calamity,
The skeletal city and blood sea will grieve your heart.

Hasten to refine it in the Cauldron Pool’s furnace,
Crafting the sun and moon’s essence with cunning.
Dao methods number in the thousands and ten thousands,
Yet among them, this one alone is supreme.

Twelve celestial talismans, nine white snows,
Three cycles and five revolutions—named Heavenly Blue.
One grain, one dose, three periods later,
The body’s nine orifices shine with radiant clarity.

White snow enters the mouth, the body sprouts feathers,
The talisman is swallowed, the feet generate clouds.
Gradually, the Three Yangs open, heralding auspicious days,
The transient life, like rotting grass, meets the spring’s rebirth.

When virtue is high and practice complete, one receives celestial rewards,
Ascending the ancestral hall, filling the home with transcendence.
Attending the early court of the Supreme Sovereign,
He casts down golden seals, jade decrees, and celestial scriptures—
The Five Peaks welcome him.

Leisurely observing the Verdant Realm’s empty hymns,
The *Sháo* (韶) music resounds, yet the *qi* remains dense.
Since the day the Five Clouds ascended in glory,
The fragrance of heaven has filled the chamber—
A scent known through ancient and modern times.

The Nine-Six celestial secrets are entrusted to me,
Treasure them in hidden chambers, do not hold them lightly.
The Perfect Ones imparted it to King Wu of the Chu (吴王李),
Yet when rejected, the thunder-fire descended immediately.

The Golden Elixir is transmitted from the Mystic Origin,
The Five *qi* disperse, yet one essence remains.
It is not the Three-One method of the swallow’s call,
Nor the saliva from turning one’s head inward.
It is not the *Guī Dān* (闺丹) art of consorting with women,
Nor the cinnabar elixir forged from arsenic ore.

Lead is the Primordial Spirit, silver is its form,
When form and spirit unite, they become the True One.
When the Primordial Spirit meets the True Form,
Then observe the Primordial Spirit in the Great Purity.

**The Precious Pagoda Formula**
Ancient method of nine tiers—
The void’s utmost, where medicines cannot reach—
Now reduced for practical use.
Or seven tiers, or five,
Each chamber six inches high,
Beneath placed the *Péng Hú* (蓬壶) vase,
With male and female *zǐkǒu* (子口) openings,
Each tier possessing subtle orifices,
To facilitate the ascent of Dragon and Tiger *qi*,
And ensure their stable union.

Sitting above the pool,
An iron ring is suspended from the ceiling beam,
Secured firmly,
Then the internal fire is ignited.
When the fire nears the *Péng Hú* (蓬壶),
A waist-high iron frame is raised,
Enveloping the fire’s force,
So that the secondary fire does not intrude upon the Precious Pagoda,
And the *Zhūquè* (朱雀) easily finds its place.

The lead is inserted at the upper gate, half an inch thick,
Its height extending to the base of the vessel.
Three sides are fortified with three supports,
Each as thick as a finger joint,
Now the fire’s power is strong.

In antiquity, it was transmitted to use a bellows to subdue the flame,
Later generations opened the wind gates,
For the sake of human convenience,
Not necessarily adhering to the old ways.

Yin and Yang are its Dao,
Adaptability is its method,
Opening and closing the wind,
Not allowing fierce gusts to disturb the cauldron’s pool,
Constantly ordering attendants to patrol,
Lest any unforeseen disaster occur—
Yet even in ordinary practice,
Though it takes a hundred days of labor,
It is the foundation for ascending to heaven.

**The Formula for Extracting True Lead**
First, extract mountain lead sand—several hundred pounds—
And pound it into powder.
Then take the mineral’s upper layer of clay soil,
For every pound of lead,
Add four ounces of salt,
Pound it ten thousand times.
Weigh out one pound of lead powder,
Wrap it in paper in multiple layers,
Seal it externally with salt clay,
Five or six divisions thick,
And dry it thoroughly under the sun."

Thus, three to five hundred [pellets],
Insert into the furnace and calcine them.

The furnace’s form resembles a large steamer,
Six to seven feet in height, a circumference of ten feet,
With bellows installed below, flames ascending from the hearth.
Spread a foot of charcoal at the base,
Then layer lead-sand pellets upon the charcoal,
Alternating layers of charcoal and pellets.

When the fire burns until the interior and exterior glow red,
Extinguish the flames and let the furnace cool,
Then cover it with damp earth.
The lead below solidifies into a single mass;
Breaking open the pellets, it emerges like raw silver ore—
This is called *Ganfu* [Dry Father].

Take this *Ganfu* to refine into *liujin* [mercury],
For then the elixir gains vitality—
Not mere lead ore mixed with clay,
Otherwise its essence will dissipate into nothingness.
Without a master’s transmission,
If one acts recklessly, it will surely lead to ruin.

The supreme elixir’s sole ingredient is refined lead.
If this treasure is obtained, all matters are complete.

This is the primordial *True One Water* of the Preheaven,
Its quantity multiplied manyfold,
To serve as the foundation for the sacred ash’s construction.

Extracting one part of true earth-water,
Its worth exceeds a pound of gold.

Now, the divine mechanism awaits the subsequent great method.

**Ancient Xi-Huang’s Method for Refining the Divine Elixir**
*Earth Element’s Initial Step, Golden Cauldron’s Divine Chamber.*

Upper and lower strings [of the furnace],
Each weighing one *jin*.
As with the Nine Cauldrons, Seven Cauldrons,
Five Cauldrons, or Three Cauldrons—
The heart follows the great method’s prescribed measures.

If using eight *liang* of white gold [silver],
Take thirty-six *jin* of black lead infused with *fuyi* [subdued qi].
For eight to nine *liang* or seventy-two *liang*,
Extract according to the Nine Pools.

Fear not the lead’s qi is insufficient—
The divine essence descends sparingly,
Making it difficult to harmonize with Heaven and Earth’s seals.
Half a *jin* to eight *liang*—
Now, refine nine *liang* to produce one *liang*,
To dissipate excess qi.

First, seek the *Earth’s Soul*—
The *Earth’s Soul* is white gold [silver].
Next, take the *Heaven’s Spirit*—
The *Heaven’s Spirit* is yellow gold [gold].
Yellow gold produces *zhushasha* [cinnabar sand],
The essence of the sun.
White gold generates flowing pearls,
The essence of the moon.
When spirit and soul unite,
The essence and brilliance spontaneously coalesce into one.

Seizing the complete function of Heaven and Earth’s sun and moon—
This is the sacred ancestor’s *Xuanyuan’s* wondrous application.
The Sage knows that divine substances conceal in the North,
Coming here to forge the elixir’s head.
Worldly gold, though of pure yang essence,
Even after a hundred refinements, will never absorb qi.
As for copper and tin,
Their nature is excessively dry,
Making it difficult to encounter the *Golden Lord*—
If encountered, their form will surely be damaged.

Only white gold,
In its singular affinity, rejoices in harmony.
Golden flowers bloom, pearls flow,
Precious pearls emerge radiant among them.
True yin and true yang,
Their lights intermingle, their bodies unite.
Skillfully applying the *Zhoutian* [Postheaven] measures,
Filling the five colors with central yellow,
Naturally, yang arises from true earth—
Earth flourishes, metal thrives.
Borrowing the *Water Tiger* to nurture and give birth to the *Shenlong* [Divine Dragon],
Five-colored scales shimmer,
Golden ointment, jade-like body,
Ever luminous and enduring,
As the ancestral elixir for ascending to heaven—
The more it is refined, the more potent it becomes;
The more it is tempered, the more wondrous it grows.

Thus, there are the *Yin Pool* and *Yang Cauldron*.
Since lead does not endure refining,
Establish methods and symbols to determine its floating and sinking nature.
Construct the cauldron as yang,
So that the yang spirit ascends to the celestial realm above.
Fashion the pool as yin,
So that the yin soul descends into the underworld below.

The *One-Nine* method’s efficacy lies in lead,
The *Two-Nine* method’s efficacy lies in the mother [mercury].
All other formulas omit the mother—
The elixir’s gate suffers in vain,
How can *Renji* [metal and water] be divided?
The aged and brittle transform into yin earth,
Using lead requires secret transmission.
Initially, gold refines lead,
Floating and sinking reveal the truth.
Preheaven and Postheaven,
Recognizing their inner essence,
No need to seek cave-dwelling immortals.
Like an infant searching for its wet nurse,
Cycle after cycle, passing through the *Xuan* [Mysterious] Gate.
The medicine is true *mercury*,
The gold elixir is the divine elixir.
One mother bears nine children,
Each transmitting their own branches and leaves.
Virtue is insufficient to encounter [it],
Karma is insufficient to hear [it].
This is the obscure, hidden true method—
Child, commit it to memory.

**Method for Establishing the Furnace and Cauldron**
Offerings to the Nine Celestial Lords of the Five Soils,
The Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper’s True Immortals,
And the Furnace’s Chief Spirit overseeing the elixir’s refinement.
The Five Deities of Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth,
Attend with incense, lamps, and offerings,
Devoutly petitioning the Supreme Truth.

Preparations include tongs, keys, and other tools,
Accumulating black tiger iron pools and precious pagodas,
Amassing them to prevent loss or damage.

Within the furnace, the wind inlet and door should be
As large as a chicken egg—
Do not make it overly wide.
If too wide, the wind’s force weakens,
And the true qi will not ascend.

The pool’s base has three supports,
Not made of iron, but fired from magnetic soil,
Arranged in a *brand* character.
Externally, secure it with salt clay,
Firm and unbroken.

Place the pool in the upper chamber,
Supported by a heavy frame,
With iron rings suspended high on the ceiling beams.
Ensure the inner fire cover is secure,
Preventing flames from nearing the cauldron.

Separately, create pathways for adding and reducing fire,
For adjusting the process as needed.

**Secret Method of the Nine Earth Pools**
*Copper Talisman, Iron Scrolls*

Two by two, the Pengluo Platform,
The Eight Treasures’ Radiant Yang Hall.
Ten Thousand Saints reverence the Central Emperor,
The Primordial Heavenly King manifests.
The King strides across the elixir’s terrace,
Commanding the Golden Lord to refine.
A single chant summons all true beings,
Golden light pervades the world.
Cautiously await the Northern Homeland’s demon,
Washing out the Celestial Garden’s dawn.
The effort lies with the elixir adept—
Abandon the old, welcome the new transformation.
Seize the *Gan’s* dazzling spirit-soul,
Do not let dark clouds disrupt [it].
Producing night-illuminating pearls,
Five colors radiant in fragments.
Above and below, let the wind circulate,
Golden dates, the face of an infant.
*Xiqi’s* yin turbidity arrives,
Deploying the *Hechē* [River Chariot] to turn.
Purple qi enters the upper chamber,
Parent and child no longer meet.
Initially producing longevity’s bloom,
Easily leading to scattered spirit.
Directly pointing to the *Hunwen*—
Named *Qing’ai* [Green Dust].

「The First Pool’s Lead Refinement Method: Use one *jin* of pure mountain gold, white as snowflakes, crushed into sixteen pieces.
On days when the sun and moon align in the same wall, when the five stars join in a single pearl, or when *Gan* and *You* (申酉) signify the gold’s vigor, place the pool and cauldron securely, open the wind gate, and introduce the *Wenwu* (文武) fires.
With gentle *Wen* (文) fire warming the pool, first cast in half a *jin* of lead, refining the ash into a solid treasure. Strengthen the foundation to prevent collapse or waste.
When the pool turns red, use nine *hu* of purified *Fuxi* lead (伏气净铅), each *hu* divided into three portions of sixty-five *zhu* (斛/株), each *zhu* as one pool, totaling nine pools with eighty-one *jin* of lead—matching the ninety-nine revolutions of the *Zhou Tian* (周天).
Insert each gold piece into the pool, then apply fierce *Wu* (武) fire to melt them into essence.
Wait only until the blackness fades and the essence reveals itself, appearing and disappearing in two cycles.
The vermilion light flickers half-illuminating the void—auspicious qi rises, floating in purple haze. Gradually add lead, letting it drip until exhausted; then replenish.
As celestial hosts rise and fall in constant motion, the treasure moon and golden flowers burst forth. Again, add lead by the *zhu*.
Do not stray from the center—
When *Gui* (癸) water is fully consumed, the "sea gold" (海金) emerges. Swiftly add lead essence, and *Ren* (壬) water ascends.
A gentle breeze scatters the golden flowers,
Yet the excess reveals *Geng* (庚) as *You* (酉) child.
Use three strong men to assist, taking turns in rotation.
Diet and rest must align with the *Bamen* (八门) openings and closings.
Add lead into the charcoal, boiling and refining with vigor.
Let the *Zhuhu* (朱雀) blaze the void,
While the purple deity’s auspicious qi ascends—
Golden date flowers bloom in crimson flames,
Generating light and essence like lightning.
Do not add lead too hastily—
Haste will prevent the *Jinwu* (金乌) from emerging from the sea.
Nor too slowly—
Slowness risks harming the *Yutu* (玉兔)’s form.
When water and fire intertwine sufficiently, without form or substance, the essence solidifies.
*Ren* water, meeting gold, naturally ascends to the *Nihuan* (泥丸) apex,
Condensing into the "sunlight pearl" (昱日流珠).
After all lead is consumed, withdraw the fire and seal the gate.
Secure the gold and replenish the water,
Then add three *qian* and four *fen* of lead.
Preserve the spirit and stabilize the form—
Do not disturb the pool or cauldron.
Once cooled, remove the *Ren* water from the cauldron,
Called the *Qing’ai* (青埃).
Or seal it in a gold or magnetic box,
Lest the qi escape. Leave it for later generations to blend with their *Yuanpei* (元配).
With bronze seals and iron scrolls,
And comrades of shared intent, guard the *Ziyang* (紫阳) Palace.
Black becomes red as the elixir,
Red becomes black as the *Weng* (翁).
The harmony of heaven and earth’s marrow—
This alone is the Dao of the elixir.
At the *Yumen* (禹门), draw three waves of water,
Letting droplets fall into the void.
On the palace’s summit, pearls roll like sunlight—
Their hue resembles purple-gold and crimson.
Within the pool, jade nectar churns,
Blown by the *Xun* (巽) wind.
The *Yutu* (玉兔) resides in *You* (酉),
The *Jinwu* (金乌) ascends to the east.
Dragon and tiger gaze from afar,
Uniting in the *Jingyang* (景阳) Palace.
Extract the lead’s treasure,
Do not rush the fire’s timing.
Calcined, the golden pearls roll—
Each pearl’s qi surges upward.
Before your eyes, red and yellow appear,
Seal the *Huagai* (華蓋) tightly.
When the lead’s impurities are exhausted,
The pool’s clarity rises, and pure essence descends.
Directly pointing to the *Hunwen*—
Named *Huangqing* (黄轻).

The Second Pool’s Lead Refinement Method follows the same principles,
But use a new pool and new cauldron, securing it as before.
Keep the *Shengmu* (圣母) unshaken—
If there’s any loss, replenish it fully.
Introduce the *Wenwu* fires,
Cast in half a *jin* of water-lead.
Strengthen the foundation.
Half the lead is consumed,
And the *Shengmu* is within.
Apply fierce fire to melt it—
The golden essence becomes clear and bright,
The *Zhuhu* (朱雀) emerges from the southern garden.
Swiftly add lead essence,
Do not let the fire rage too fiercely;
Last night’s child just parted from its mother,
Today’s younger sibling follows the same.
Add lead by the *zhu* and *bu*—
No distinction between black tortoise and lead,
Nor between flames of varied hues;
On the purple-gold platform, frost condenses,
Before the white jade hall, the mother gazes with one eye.
*Bingding* (丙丁) ascends in measured strides,
Lead drips into the bones.
After all lead is consumed,
The mirror remains pristine and dust-free.
Withdraw the fire and seal the gate.
Add the "secure lead" (安全之铅) of two *qian* and three *fen*,
Boiled in a cold furnace overnight.
Gently tap to retrieve the pearls rolling on the cauldron’s surface,
Called the *Huangqing* (黄轻).
Seal them separately, then shift to a new pool and cauldron.

With bronze seals and iron scrolls,
The Great Dao is without complication—
Lead and mercury are two kinds.
Lead treats mercury with kindness,
Mercury treats lead with righteousness.
The divine elixir is one flavor of lead,
Holding within it the *Xiantian* (先天) qi.
The *Bingding* (丙丁) partners mediate,
Transforming the *Huangpo* (黄婆) power.
Transport relies on the *Hechē* (河车),
Mercury absorbing lead’s essence.
In rising and falling,
One follows the other.
The *Huagai* (華蓋) renews daily,
Pearls are called "as one wishes" (如意).
Yellow cranes fill the sky in flight,
Green heavens crackle with thunder.
*Qianjin* (乾金) reveals purple brilliance,
Do not let lead fall short.
Now, open the four gates,
Seal above the *Xuanqiao* (玄窍).
Disturb the lead’s qi,
And the golden pool must be sealed tight.
Such is the fire’s alchemy—
Without form or substance.
Directly pointing to the *Hunwen*—
Named *Jinyue* (金液).

The Third Pool’s Lead Refinement Method follows the same principles as before.
Secure the pool with a three-legged stand,
Place the cauldron on top, and seal it firmly.
The sacred body remains unharmed—
Any loss must be fully replenished.
Within the *Zhujī* (筑基) pool, ignite fierce flames.
Three *Wen* and three *Wu* fires nurture the yellow sprout,
Lead ascends and descends in cycles—
Flames blaze, essence does not falter;
Lead begins without form,
Gold reverses to its original state.
Follow the prescribed measures when adding lead,
Treating it with utmost care.
The green dragon retreats three times,
The white tiger flips its body to return to earth.
Add lead essence in cycles—
Start and end as before.
In the western pool, the sun and moon meet,
Seizing the pure fragrance to depart.
Dragon’s mist glows red like fire,
True fire engulfs the dragon’s mist.
After all lead is added,
Withdraw the fire and halt the furnace.
Add the "secure lead" (安全之铅) of one *qian* and two *fen*.
The first three pools represent the eldest son’s manifestation,
*Zhen* (震) and *Geng* (庚) receiving the talisman—
A total of seven *qian* of secure lead, corresponding to the seven-day return of the *Tianfu* (天符).
The subsequent six pools will not use this method.»

Withdraw the fire and let the furnace grow cold,
Extract the *rénshuǐ* (壬水) from the crucible above—
Called **"Jīnyè" (金液)**—seal it clearly and replace with a fresh pool for further work.

**Copper Talisman, Iron Scrolls**
Eastward, the Sun’s crystal emerges,
Its radiance dazzling and bright.
Illuminating all under heaven,
Its dew enters the jade city’s waves.

Day and night it turns east and west,
Setting in the west, rising again in the east.
The Great Mother of the Sun opens and closes,
All things receive its luminous essence.

The marrow of Heaven and Earth—
The root of the Dao of Immortal Elixir.

In the *Kūn* (坤) month, as the moon wanes,
Darkness deepens, embodying the *Tàiyīn* (太阴).
A faint star glimmers in the southwest,
While the Sun traverses the eastern land,
The Moon gradually moves southward.

By the seventh and eighth days, its light floats within,
Gradually filling a *hú* (斛) measure.
Half black, half white—
The white is the essence of gold.

Without the power of the *Sānjiǎo* (三足), the Moon’s brilliance would not arise.
At the fifteenth day, over *Jiǎdì* (甲地),
The elixir’s light fills the Jade Capital.

Directly pointing to *Hánwén* (函文), it is called **"Hóngxiá" (红霞)**.

The fourth pool’s lead and fire regimen
Follows the same as before.

Do not disturb the Sacred Embryo;
Wait for the Mother to enter the pool,
Then ignite the Great Fire with wind.

Proceed with lead as before—
No *xùntǒng* (荀筒) may be used.
Three days, three fusions yield True Lead—
Only when yin and yang are resolved does it emerge.

Again, advance the lead *yáo* (爻),
Each step continuous.

The Golden Elixir relies on *Gēngxīn* (庚辛) power—
Without *Rén*, *Gēng* cannot form; without *Guǐ* (癸), it cannot separate.

Observe the lead and *rénshuǐ*—
Their interplay refines the white gold.
When metal and water unite,
Common sons become sacred descendants.

The Mother melts in the Hua Pool—
Each must be distinctly observed.
Five-colored radiance arises,
Enveloping it in crimson mist.

Hour by hour, scenes gleam like gold and jade,
Day by day, the flowers bloom anew in form.

Begin only with silver and lead,
Dispersing lead and mercury,
Exhausting every *tǔzhū* (土铢),
Leaving the furnace cold through the night.
Extract the *rénshuǐ* from the crucible—
Called **"Hóngxiá" (红霞)**—record it, replace the pool, and refine anew.

**Copper Talisman, Iron Scrolls**
Black lead is Heaven’s essence,
White gold is Earth’s fluid.
Black hides within water, bearing yang;
White holds fire’s qi.

Black and white alternate, returning to their proper places.
Their natures intertwine—
The *Dānjīng* (丹经) calls them kindred.

Black submits to white as master,
Yin pairs with yang as consort.
When yin and yang merge in chaos,
Petals of gold bloom emerald-green.

The Treasure Moon fills the *Dāntián* (丹田),
Boiling fiercely in the crucible’s heat.
Do not seal—open the Heavenly Aperture,
Let it breathe in and out.
In the midst of churning—
The tortoise hides itself.

The secret incantation’s marvel,
The fire’s measure lies in its signs.

Nurturing the Sacred Descendant within the common—
All else is but this singular treasure.

**A Daily Birth of Sons**
Each day a son is born—
Each son dwells in his own chamber.

*"Direct-Pointing Scroll"*—named *Liújīn* (流金)
The fifth pool’s lead-refining fire:
Harvesting the pool’s cauldron—
Each step identical.

The Holy Mother enters the pool,
Wind opens the golden elixir.
Cast lead as before,
Ever add charcoal within.

corresponding to four thousand three hundred twenty years of cosmic *qì*.
Thus, within each hour, the talismanic fire advances and retreats,
seizing the pristine *qì* of four thousand three hundred twenty years
and returning it to the Divine Cauldron.

The fundamental count of the talismanic fire aligns with the four hexagrams of **乾 (Qián, Heaven)**, **坤 (Kūn, Earth)**, **坎 (Kǎn, Abyss)**, and **离 (Lí, Flame)** as its core, while the remaining sixty hexagrams serve as its application. The lines total **三百六十 (sānbǎiliù, three hundred sixty)**, each line representing one star, each star corresponding to one *铢 (zhū, grain)*. At the hour of **子 (Zǐ)**, the Yang-Fire advances **三十六铢 (sānlìzhū, thirty-six grains)**, with **二十四铢 (èrshísìzhū, twenty-four grains)** constituting one *两 (liǎng, ounce)*, and the remaining **十二铢 (shí'èrzhū, twelve grains)** as half an ounce. Thus, in the hour of **子**, one attains **Yang-Fire** of one and a half *两*, the first six hours belonging to Yang. Its total count reaches nine, and so the Yang-Fire advances nine *两* in sequence, amounting to **二百一十六体 (èrbǎiyīshíliù tǐ, two hundred sixteen lines)**.

The remaining **少阳 (Shàoyáng, Lesser Yang)** and **少阴 (Shàoyīn, Lesser Yin)** counts, spanning five days, do not fall under the standard reckoning. The Yin-Talismans, from **午 (Wǔ)** to **亥 (Hài)**, all belong to Yin, their lines also diminishing to **一百四十四铢 (yībǎisìshízhū, one hundred forty-four grains)**, totaling six. Six marks the strategy of **老阴 (Lǎoyīn, Elder Yin)**.

At **午 (Wǔ)**, the Yin-Talismans retreat **二十四爻 (èrshísìyáo, twenty-four lines)**, each line as one *铢 (zhū, grain)*, twenty-four grains making one *两 (liǎng, ounce)*. Thus, in the six Yin-hours, one attains fire of six *两*, totaling **一百四十四铢 (yībǎisìshízhū, one hundred forty-four grains)**. The first six Yang-hours yield nine, the latter six Yin-hours yield six—the interplay of **Yang-nine and Yang-six** is thus complete.

In sum, **三百六十支 (sānbǎiliùzhī, three hundred sixty branches)** coalesce into the **神室 (Shénshì, Divine Chamber)**’s one *斤 (jīn, catty)* in essence and application. Now, nine and six total **十五两 (shíwǔliǎng, fifteen ounces)**, while **乾 (Qián, Heaven)** and **坤 (Kūn, Earth)** serve as the **鼎器 (Dǐngqì, Cauldron Vessels)**, and **坎 (Kǎn, Abyss)** and **离 (Lí, Flame)** as the **药物 (Yàowù, Medicinal Substances)**. The **二十四爻 (èrshísìyáo, twenty-four lines)** correspond to one *两 (liǎng, ounce)*.

For those who follow in refining the Great Elixir, adhering to the Master’s intent: fire is the parent of the elixir, the elixir the offspring of fire. Passed down from mouth to mouth, from heart to heart, one must focus solely on fire.

**逊 (Xùn)** said: *"The Divine Chamber holds one catty, and the fire’s count also equals one catty—neither may be neglected. Now the fire is only fifteen ounces, what then is its purpose?"*

**元君 (Yuánjūn, Primordial Lord)** replied: *"The advancement and retreat of talismanic fire within the Cauldron follow the waxing and waning of the lunar light in the heavens. Thus, a day has twelve hours, a year has twelve months, each hour mirroring a month. The first seven and a half days are spring, the latter seven and a half are summer—the breath of generation; the middle seven and a half days are autumn, the last seven and a half are winter—the breath of destruction. Hence, fire is limited to fifteen ounces, aligning with the exact count of the moon’s full radiance. If one adds an ounce, the Elder Yin oversteps its domain, invading the Yin-lands and causing the soul to perish—fire is transmitted, but not the elixir."*

The true mechanism of talismanic fire lies within the interplay of nine and six. In the hour of **子**, the fire is at its peak—contemplate its intent. Ritual purity is the direct path.

Now, the method of refining the elixir suffices for a year, yet only **十月 (shíyuè, the tenth month)** yields the completed elixir—why so? It is because in the **二八 (èr-bā, second and eighth)** months, each has its own pause and respite.

The **二月 (èr yuè, second month)**, ruled by the **兔 (tù, Hare)**, sees Yang-*qi* flourishing while Yin-*qi* first emerges—at the time when **榆荚 (yújiá, elm seeds)** begin to fall, one restrains the **卯木 (mǎo mù, Wood of the Hare)** fire and augments the **水 (shuǐ, Water)** to ensure safety. The **八月 (bā yuè, eighth month)**, ruled by the **鸡 (jī, Rooster)**, sees Yin-*qi* flourishing while Yang-*qi* first emerges—at the time when **荠麦 (jìmài, bittercress and millet)** gradually sprout, one restrains the **酉金 (yǒu jīn, Metal of the Rooster)** water and enhances the **火 (huǒ, Fire)** to secure stability.

In refining the Great Elixir, one must rely on fire, and the standard of hexagram lines determines its exact count. Otherwise, the days of its proper measure will be lost.

The fire, though advancing by fifteen *liang* at a time, only after a hundred days penetrates the core of the golden cauldron. Subtle yet taking form, it gestates the golden elixir.

After refining one cauldron externally for over a hundred days, open it to observe the golden elixir—whether like a lamp’s blossom or cloud formations, with the five *xiàng* (symbols) fully manifest, announcing to the Supreme Emperor and High Immortals. Take and ingest one *jiǔ* (ninth), and after a hundred days of gathering essence and accumulating *qi*, prolonging life and extending years.

Still, nurture it warmly until the full cycle of the Microcosmic Orbit is complete. When ten months of work are fulfilled, without substance generating substance, forming the *Tāi* (Great Harmony) rice and mysterious pearl, only then is it the true elixir.

One cauldron of refined *línggǒng* (spirit-mercury), when ingested, will forever solidify the form.

All friends should redouble their diligence in cultivation, until the three-year spirit-elixir, the nine-year white snow, the twelve divine talismans, when rubble turns to gold and withered bones become flesh—form and spirit both perfected, all virtues complete. Flowers bloom, fruit ripens, and one wanders in delight through the Supreme Clarity.

You should treasure these three volumes of sacred scripture, for their words are exhaustive and their meaning complete. I now return to the Jade Capital.

chunks.original_text: 铜符铁卷 总诀 三元神丹口诀 玉清有命封仙职，掌握南曹主化一。 赤文幽隐彭仪房，玄科至禁蓝天碧。 八万四千一劫传，传出天符火记历。 庚甲之年杂气消，诸天庆会万余室。 稽首恭默大道前，万圣千真总湛寂。 琼台遐想玉清客，颦眉不展忧心匿。 良久开扬九六门，驾鹤斜闻龟仰觅。 大道流行满上天，尔曹仙子乐无边。 龙汉延康三劫尽，玄宫大展令敷宜。 东华升举西华主，太乙元君谌母传。 亲受皇人二八机，至玄至妙至幽微。 可令尘环流玉液，早将仙子赴瑶池。 珠台降下铜符卷，敕下元君谌母知。 弘道真人弘道仙，阐扬正教汞和铅。 铅飞雪浪流珠滚，覆下依然真土眠。 土禀天符生碧叶，朵朵金花起紫烟。 紫烟飞上凌霄殿，连连续续水花片。 日月抛光朗大千，巽风吹起金花现。 不得流珠不计铅，生灵聚景防危战。 日魂将迁月神圆，赫赫日魂霞九万。 四方笼罩合真铅，铅含五彩何人见。 炼铅无计觅真传，不得庚金华不坝。 采得辛金一味真，再入灰池取次炼。 上下浮沉颠倒间，壬花莫令乌云乱。 抽出天魂霞夺日，水晶宫里是吾家。 返得流金回圣体，何劳磋跎遍天涯。 汞死为铅铅化土，白金鼎器丹之祖。 怀尽天魂地魄中，玄元称此为丹母。 汞积九九返成砂，龙出东方西就虎。 晋世明王孝道存，金筋玉骨许之孙。 咒将敕水降魔魁，明功暗德济苍生。 可将铁卷天王旨，铜符细细口传君。 玉清愿见功勋士，光眉大展笑颜欣。 巨阙弥封碧玉匣，明珠照世破幽城。 速令名山拿玉兔，灿日擒归再莫论。 日魂消尽千山雪，奚虑区区遍体阴。 但烹黍米扶神气，看看天时偏五陵。 恶龙喷出三江水，毒气零零满世尘。 若不敕汝扶厄难，骨城血海痛伤心。 急以鼎池炉里炼，巧夺乾坤日月精。 道法千门及万户，千门万户独斯尊。 十二神符九白雪，三回五转号天青。 一粒一服三期后，周身九窍自光明。 白雪入口身生羽，神符吞下足生云。 渐觉三阳开泰日，浮生腐草尽逢春。 功高行备膺天禄，拨宅升腾及满门。 早朝上帝抛金玺玉诏天书五岳迎。 闲观碧落空歌韶，时传空青始气森。 一自五云腾腾日，天香满室古今闻。 九六天机亲嘱付，珍藏室秘莫为轻。 至人授受吴王李，非之雷火即时临。 金丹递运玄无始，五气分张一气成。 不比燕呼三一法，不是回头口内津。 不是闺丹御女术，不是砒黄丹矿成。 铅是元神银是形，形神相得合为真。 元神相遇真形后，果用元神观太清。 宝塔诀 古法九层，虚极药所不至，今减而用之。 或七层五层，每屋高六寸，下安蓬壶，雌雄子口，层层俱有妙窍，以便龙虎气升，安合固济。 坐于池上，外用铁环高挂于天梁上，令其安稳，方架内火。 火近蓬壶，腰下以铁架架起，经围火力，庶使次火难侵于宝塔，朱雀易得安身。 进铅门上用半寸，高连壶脚下。 三方安三足，厚方如指节，今火势有力。 上古传受，用风箱伏火，后人遂开风门，用处在人活法，不必—一构旧。 阴阳为之道，变通为之法，风一开一闭，不使疾风吹惊池鼎，恒令人巡视恐有不虞之患，美作寻常为之，虽曰百日之功劳，乃是升天之基址。 烧取真铅诀 一初取出山铅砂数百斤，捣为末。 就用矿上圳土，每一斤，配食盐四两，捣万杵。 秤定铅砂末一斤以纸包裹数层，外用盐泥固之五六分厚，晒令极干。

**"The Copper Talisman and Iron Scroll: Master Formula of the Three Primordial Elixirs**

When the Jade Purity bestows the decree of immortal office,
It governs the Southern Cauldron, mastering the transformation of all things.
The crimson script is profound and hidden in Pengyi’s chamber,
The dark arts are most forbidden beneath the azure sky’s verdant expanse.

Eight myriads, four thousand—one kalpa’s legacy—
Passed down through celestial talismans, inscribed by the Fire Record’s chronicle.
In the year of *Gēng-Jiǎ* (庚甲), chaotic *qi* dissolves,
As myriad heavenly assemblies rejoice in their grand celestial halls.

Prostrating in reverence before the Great Dao,
Ten thousand sages and true ones abide in profound stillness.
Gazing afar upon the Crystal Terrace, guests of Jade Purity,
The brows remain unfurrowed, yet the heart is heavy with concealed sorrow.

After long deliberation, the Nine-Six Gates are raised,
And the crane’s flight is heard as it seeks the turtle’s upward gaze.
The Great Dao spreads, filling the heavens above,
Your ranks of immortals rejoice without bound.

When the Three Kalpas of the Dragon and Han dynasties conclude,
The Mystic Palace unfolds its vast and auspicious domain.
The Eastern and Western Hua ascend in turn,
The Grand Sovereign of the Great Unity, *Zhēn Mǔ* (谌母), is transmitted.

Receiving the august decree of the Second Eight,
Most profound, most wondrous, most subtle and hidden.
It can make the dusty world flow with jade nectar,
And swiftly summon the immortal to the Celestial Pool.

The Pearl Terrace descends the Copper Talisman and Iron Scroll,
Imperially bestowed to *Zhēn Mǔ* (谌母) for her knowledge.
The Great Dao’s True Person expounds the Dao’s immortal secrets,
Interpreting the orthodox teachings: mercury and lead in harmony.

Lead ascends like snow-waves, pearls roll in flight,
Yet when lowered, it rests as true earth in slumber.
Earth, in response to the talisman’s decree, bears emerald leaves,
Each blossom a golden flower, rising in purple mist.

The purple mist ascends to the Lingxiao Hall,
Continuously linked, like scattered petals of water.
The sun and moon cast their radiant light upon the Great Thousand,
The *Xùn* (巽) wind blows, revealing golden flowers.

Without the rolling pearls, one cannot measure the lead,
As living beings gather their essence to ward off perilous battles.
The solar spirit is about to depart, the lunar deity is full,
Resplendent solar spirits, nine myriads in glory.

The four quarters are enveloped by the True Lead’s fusion,
Lead containing five colors—who could ever perceive?
Refining lead without measuring the True Transmission,
One cannot find *Gēng Jīn Huà* (庚金华) without obstruction.

Harvesting the True Lead of *Xīn Jīn* (辛金), a single essence,
Then returning to the Ash Pool for further purification.
Ascending and descending in tumultuous flux,
Do not let the *Rén Huā* (壬花) be disordered by black clouds.

Extracting the celestial spirit, seizing the solar mist,
Within the Water Crystal Palace—there lies my true abode.
Retrieving the rolling gold to restore the sacred form,
Why toil endlessly across the vast expanse of the world?

Mercury dies, becoming lead, which then transforms into earth,
The white gold vessel—the ancestor of the elixir’s foundation.
Exhausting the celestial spirit and terrestrial essence,
The Primordial Origin calls this the *Dān Mǔ* (丹母).

Mercury accumulates ninety-nine times, returning as sand,
The Dragon emerges from the east, the Tiger from the west.
In the Jin dynasty, the enlightened king preserved filial virtue,
His golden sinews and jade bones granted to his descendants.

The incantation commands the water to subdue the demonic leader,
His manifest and covert virtues benefit all under heaven.
Take the Iron Scroll’s decree of the Heavenly King,
And the Copper Talisman’s subtle secrets, passed orally to you.

The Jade Purity wishes to see the virtuous and meritorious,
His broad brows unfurl, his face bright with joy.
The Great Obstruction is sealed within a jade casket,
A radiant pearl shatters the world, revealing its hidden citadel.

Swiftly seize the famous mountain’s jade hare,
Dazzling the sun, capturing it—no further debate.
When the solar spirit is exhausted, the thousand mountains turn white,
Why fret over trifles when the body is already shadowed?

Simply boil millet to nourish the spirit-*qi*,
Observing the celestial timing, leaning toward the Five Tombs.

The malevolent dragon spews forth the Three Rivers’ waters,
Its venomous *qi* scatters, staining the world’s dust.
If you do not command it to aid in calamity,
The skeletal city and blood sea will grieve your heart.

Hasten to refine it in the Cauldron Pool’s furnace,
Crafting the sun and moon’s essence with cunning.
Dao methods number in the thousands and ten thousands,
Yet among them, this one alone is supreme.

Twelve celestial talismans, nine white snows,
Three cycles and five revolutions—named Heavenly Blue.
One grain, one dose, three periods later,
The body’s nine orifices shine with radiant clarity.

White snow enters the mouth, the body sprouts feathers,
The talisman is swallowed, the feet generate clouds.
Gradually, the Three Yangs open, heralding auspicious days,
The transient life, like rotting grass, meets the spring’s rebirth.

When virtue is high and practice complete, one receives celestial rewards,
Ascending the ancestral hall, filling the home with transcendence.
Attending the early court of the Supreme Sovereign,
He casts down golden seals, jade decrees, and celestial scriptures—
The Five Peaks welcome him.

Leisurely observing the Verdant Realm’s empty hymns,
The *Sháo* (韶) music resounds, yet the *qi* remains dense.
Since the day the Five Clouds ascended in glory,
The fragrance of heaven has filled the chamber—
A scent known through ancient and modern times.

The Nine-Six celestial secrets are entrusted to me,
Treasure them in hidden chambers, do not hold them lightly.
The Perfect Ones imparted it to King Wu of the Chu (吴王李),
Yet when rejected, the thunder-fire descended immediately.

The Golden Elixir is transmitted from the Mystic Origin,
The Five *qi* disperse, yet one essence remains.
It is not the Three-One method of the swallow’s call,
Nor the saliva from turning one’s head inward.
It is not the *Guī Dān* (闺丹) art of consorting with women,
Nor the cinnabar elixir forged from arsenic ore.

Lead is the Primordial Spirit, silver is its form,
When form and spirit unite, they become the True One.
When the Primordial Spirit meets the True Form,
Then observe the Primordial Spirit in the Great Purity.

**The Precious Pagoda Formula**
Ancient method of nine tiers—
The void’s utmost, where medicines cannot reach—
Now reduced for practical use.
Or seven tiers, or five,
Each chamber six inches high,
Beneath placed the *Péng Hú* (蓬壶) vase,
With male and female *zǐkǒu* (子口) openings,
Each tier possessing subtle orifices,
To facilitate the ascent of Dragon and Tiger *qi*,
And ensure their stable union.

Sitting above the pool,
An iron ring is suspended from the ceiling beam,
Secured firmly,
Then the internal fire is ignited.
When the fire nears the *Péng Hú* (蓬壶),
A waist-high iron frame is raised,
Enveloping the fire’s force,
So that the secondary fire does not intrude upon the Precious Pagoda,
And the *Zhūquè* (朱雀) easily finds its place.

The lead is inserted at the upper gate, half an inch thick,
Its height extending to the base of the vessel.
Three sides are fortified with three supports,
Each as thick as a finger joint,
Now the fire’s power is strong.

In antiquity, it was transmitted to use a bellows to subdue the flame,
Later generations opened the wind gates,
For the sake of human convenience,
Not necessarily adhering to the old ways.

Yin and Yang are its Dao,
Adaptability is its method,
Opening and closing the wind,
Not allowing fierce gusts to disturb the cauldron’s pool,
Constantly ordering attendants to patrol,
Lest any unforeseen disaster occur—
Yet even in ordinary practice,
Though it takes a hundred days of labor,
It is the foundation for ascending to heaven.

**The Formula for Extracting True Lead**
First, extract mountain lead sand—several hundred pounds—
And pound it into powder.
Then take the mineral’s upper layer of clay soil,
For every pound of lead,
Add four ounces of salt,
Pound it ten thousand times.
Weigh out one pound of lead powder,
Wrap it in paper in multiple layers,
Seal it externally with salt clay,
Five or six divisions thick,
And dry it thoroughly under the sun."

chunks.original_text: 如此三五百枚，入炉煅之。 炉式形如大甑，高六七尺，周围一丈，下安风箱，底火上升。 用炭铺底一尺厚，方铺铅砂球在炭上，层炭层球。 大火煅得内外通红，止火寒炉，阴土覆上。 铅在下成一块，破球取出如生矿银状，如此，谓之乾父。 将此乾父取流金，则药有精神，非是流铅圳土，否则神散杳茫。 不得师授，苟或妄为，终为误事。 神丹至药，只是一味铅精，若得此宝，万事毕矣。 此为先天真一之水，多倍其数，以听圣灰筑基之用。 采取土水一分真，不换黄金重一斤。 至此，神机又听后续大法。 古羲黄修炼神丹大法 地元起手，金鼎神室。 上下两弦，体重一斤。 如九鼎七鼎，五鼎、三鼎，心依大法度数采用。 假如白金八两，用伏气黑铅三十六斤。 只有八九七十二两，按九池而取之。 恐铅气不足。 神精降少，难合天地符契，半斤八两之数。 今用九两炼一两，泄气之用。 先求地魄，地魄者，白金也。 次取天魂，天魂者，黄金也。 黄金产珠砂。 是日精。 白金生流珠，是月华。 魂魄合体，精华自生一。 夺天地日月之全功，是圣祖玄元之妙用。 圣人知神物隐于北方，来此以作丹头。 不用世上黄金，黄金虽纯阳之体，纵加百炼，决不受气。 至于铜锡，性质大燥，难见金公，见则形必伤也。 独与白金，一味相亲，畅体欣然。 金花发泄流珠，珍珠豁然其间。 真阴真阳，交光合体。 巧取周天度数，满于五色中黄，自然阳生于真土也，土旺金乡。 借水虎育养而生震龙，五色霞鳞，金膏碧体，朗朗常存，为升天药祖，愈炼愈灵，越温越妙。 故有阴池阳鼎。 因铅不受炼，设为法象，以定浮沉之性。 造鼎为阳，使阳魂自升于天堂之上。 制池为阴，使阴魄自沉于地狱之中。 一九功在铅，二九功在母。 诸方不用母，丹门甘自苦，壬癸怎分强。 老脆化阴土，用铅有秘传。 始初金炼铅，浮沉定得真。 先天与后天，认得其中趣，无拘洞里仙。 婴儿寻乳母，转转出玄关。 药即是真汞，金丹是神丹。 一母生九子，各自传枝叶。 德薄不足以遇，缘浅不足以闻。 此是杳冥真诀，子宜记在胸襟。 安炉立鼎诀 上供九天五土司命、北斗七天真君、丹房炉嘱正神。 金木水火土五德星君，侍供香火灯烛果品，虔告上真。 预造钳匙等器，余积黑虎铁池宝塔，多备以防损换。 炉内合风开门如鸡子大，勿令大宽。 宽则风力缓，缓则真气不升。 池下三方，安三足，不用铁造，以磁土烧就，安如品字。 外以盐泥固之，坚牢不损。 安池在上方，架重楼，两边以铁环高挂于天梁之上。 内火盖固，不令火力近鼎。 别开出入火路，以便加减行持。 地元九池秘诀 铜符铁卷 两两彭罗台，八宝昭阳殿。 万圣拱中尊，元始天王现。 王如啸丹墀，方使金公炼。 一唱众真场，世界金光遍。 谨候北丰魔，洗出朝天苑。 用力在丹人，弃旧迎新换。 乾金夺目魂，莫令乌云乱。 产出夜明珠，五色辉煌片。 上下令通风，金枣婴儿面。 希夷阴浊来，放展河车转。 紫气入重楼，子母不相见。 初产寿年华，易到精神散。 直指函文名曰青埃

Thus, three to five hundred [pellets],
Insert into the furnace and calcine them.

The furnace’s form resembles a large steamer,
Six to seven feet in height, a circumference of ten feet,
With bellows installed below, flames ascending from the hearth.
Spread a foot of charcoal at the base,
Then layer lead-sand pellets upon the charcoal,
Alternating layers of charcoal and pellets.

When the fire burns until the interior and exterior glow red,
Extinguish the flames and let the furnace cool,
Then cover it with damp earth.
The lead below solidifies into a single mass;
Breaking open the pellets, it emerges like raw silver ore—
This is called *Ganfu* [Dry Father].

Take this *Ganfu* to refine into *liujin* [mercury],
For then the elixir gains vitality—
Not mere lead ore mixed with clay,
Otherwise its essence will dissipate into nothingness.
Without a master’s transmission,
If one acts recklessly, it will surely lead to ruin.

The supreme elixir’s sole ingredient is refined lead.
If this treasure is obtained, all matters are complete.

This is the primordial *True One Water* of the Preheaven,
Its quantity multiplied manyfold,
To serve as the foundation for the sacred ash’s construction.

Extracting one part of true earth-water,
Its worth exceeds a pound of gold.

Now, the divine mechanism awaits the subsequent great method.

**Ancient Xi-Huang’s Method for Refining the Divine Elixir**
*Earth Element’s Initial Step, Golden Cauldron’s Divine Chamber.*

Upper and lower strings [of the furnace],
Each weighing one *jin*.
As with the Nine Cauldrons, Seven Cauldrons,
Five Cauldrons, or Three Cauldrons—
The heart follows the great method’s prescribed measures.

If using eight *liang* of white gold [silver],
Take thirty-six *jin* of black lead infused with *fuyi* [subdued qi].
For eight to nine *liang* or seventy-two *liang*,
Extract according to the Nine Pools.

Fear not the lead’s qi is insufficient—
The divine essence descends sparingly,
Making it difficult to harmonize with Heaven and Earth’s seals.
Half a *jin* to eight *liang*—
Now, refine nine *liang* to produce one *liang*,
To dissipate excess qi.

First, seek the *Earth’s Soul*—
The *Earth’s Soul* is white gold [silver].
Next, take the *Heaven’s Spirit*—
The *Heaven’s Spirit* is yellow gold [gold].
Yellow gold produces *zhushasha* [cinnabar sand],
The essence of the sun.
White gold generates flowing pearls,
The essence of the moon.
When spirit and soul unite,
The essence and brilliance spontaneously coalesce into one.

Seizing the complete function of Heaven and Earth’s sun and moon—
This is the sacred ancestor’s *Xuanyuan’s* wondrous application.
The Sage knows that divine substances conceal in the North,
Coming here to forge the elixir’s head.
Worldly gold, though of pure yang essence,
Even after a hundred refinements, will never absorb qi.
As for copper and tin,
Their nature is excessively dry,
Making it difficult to encounter the *Golden Lord*—
If encountered, their form will surely be damaged.

Only white gold,
In its singular affinity, rejoices in harmony.
Golden flowers bloom, pearls flow,
Precious pearls emerge radiant among them.
True yin and true yang,
Their lights intermingle, their bodies unite.
Skillfully applying the *Zhoutian* [Postheaven] measures,
Filling the five colors with central yellow,
Naturally, yang arises from true earth—
Earth flourishes, metal thrives.
Borrowing the *Water Tiger* to nurture and give birth to the *Shenlong* [Divine Dragon],
Five-colored scales shimmer,
Golden ointment, jade-like body,
Ever luminous and enduring,
As the ancestral elixir for ascending to heaven—
The more it is refined, the more potent it becomes;
The more it is tempered, the more wondrous it grows.

Thus, there are the *Yin Pool* and *Yang Cauldron*.
Since lead does not endure refining,
Establish methods and symbols to determine its floating and sinking nature.
Construct the cauldron as yang,
So that the yang spirit ascends to the celestial realm above.
Fashion the pool as yin,
So that the yin soul descends into the underworld below.

The *One-Nine* method’s efficacy lies in lead,
The *Two-Nine* method’s efficacy lies in the mother [mercury].
All other formulas omit the mother—
The elixir’s gate suffers in vain,
How can *Renji* [metal and water] be divided?
The aged and brittle transform into yin earth,
Using lead requires secret transmission.
Initially, gold refines lead,
Floating and sinking reveal the truth.
Preheaven and Postheaven,
Recognizing their inner essence,
No need to seek cave-dwelling immortals.
Like an infant searching for its wet nurse,
Cycle after cycle, passing through the *Xuan* [Mysterious] Gate.
The medicine is true *mercury*,
The gold elixir is the divine elixir.
One mother bears nine children,
Each transmitting their own branches and leaves.
Virtue is insufficient to encounter [it],
Karma is insufficient to hear [it].
This is the obscure, hidden true method—
Child, commit it to memory.

**Method for Establishing the Furnace and Cauldron**
Offerings to the Nine Celestial Lords of the Five Soils,
The Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper’s True Immortals,
And the Furnace’s Chief Spirit overseeing the elixir’s refinement.
The Five Deities of Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth,
Attend with incense, lamps, and offerings,
Devoutly petitioning the Supreme Truth.

Preparations include tongs, keys, and other tools,
Accumulating black tiger iron pools and precious pagodas,
Amassing them to prevent loss or damage.

Within the furnace, the wind inlet and door should be
As large as a chicken egg—
Do not make it overly wide.
If too wide, the wind’s force weakens,
And the true qi will not ascend.

The pool’s base has three supports,
Not made of iron, but fired from magnetic soil,
Arranged in a *brand* character.
Externally, secure it with salt clay,
Firm and unbroken.

Place the pool in the upper chamber,
Supported by a heavy frame,
With iron rings suspended high on the ceiling beams.
Ensure the inner fire cover is secure,
Preventing flames from nearing the cauldron.

Separately, create pathways for adding and reducing fire,
For adjusting the process as needed.

**Secret Method of the Nine Earth Pools**
*Copper Talisman, Iron Scrolls*

Two by two, the Pengluo Platform,
The Eight Treasures’ Radiant Yang Hall.
Ten Thousand Saints reverence the Central Emperor,
The Primordial Heavenly King manifests.
The King strides across the elixir’s terrace,
Commanding the Golden Lord to refine.
A single chant summons all true beings,
Golden light pervades the world.
Cautiously await the Northern Homeland’s demon,
Washing out the Celestial Garden’s dawn.
The effort lies with the elixir adept—
Abandon the old, welcome the new transformation.
Seize the *Gan’s* dazzling spirit-soul,
Do not let dark clouds disrupt [it].
Producing night-illuminating pearls,
Five colors radiant in fragments.
Above and below, let the wind circulate,
Golden dates, the face of an infant.
*Xiqi’s* yin turbidity arrives,
Deploying the *Hechē* [River Chariot] to turn.
Purple qi enters the upper chamber,
Parent and child no longer meet.
Initially producing longevity’s bloom,
Easily leading to scattered spirit.
Directly pointing to the *Hunwen*—
Named *Qing’ai* [Green Dust].

chunks.original_text: 第一池炼铅法：则用出山净金一斤，白如雪朵，碎作十六片。 乃于日月合壁日、五星联珠日、申酉金旺日，将池鼎安置停当，开风门，进文武大。 文火温池，先投铅半斤，炼灰池结宝，基址坚固，免致折耗之患。 待池将红，另用伏气净铅九斛，每斛分三进六十五株，每铢为一池，九池共铅八十一斤，以应九九周天之数。 将金片片入池，武火溶化成汁。 只待黑尽自现，一上一下浮现。 两旋红光闪闪半虚空，瑞气炎炎浮紫廓，取次入铅，漏尽再添； 满天星宿浮沉转，宝月金花劈面来，铅铢又进。 莫离方寸； 看看癸水尽，方见海金螯，急进铅爻，壬水上潮； 和风吹得金花散，散却盈庚见酉孩； 须用有力三人，互相轮换。 饮食起居，八门开闭。 进铅入炭，猛烹急炼。 使朱雀炎空，紫神瑞气，金枣花红火火，生光爻爻露电。 进铅不可大急，急则金乌不出海。 又不可大缓，缓则玉兔恐伤形。 水火交缠数足，无形合虚，旷然成质。 壬水得金，自然升上泥丸之顶，结就昱日流珠。 铅数投尽，退火封门。 安金益水，进铅三钱四分。 保神固形，不可有动池鼎。 冷定取出，摘下鼎中壬水，号曰“青埃”。 或金盒磁盒封固，勿令泄气，听后人元配合。 铜符铁卷 同志二三人，固守紫阳宫。 黑以白为丹，红以黑为翁。 中和天地髓，只此是丹宗。 禹门三汲浪，漏滴令空空。 殿上流珠滚，色似紫金红、池中翻玉液，吹嘘籍巽风。 玉兔酉为宅，金乌日上东。 龙虎遥相望，会合景阳宫。 抽取铅中宝，火候莫匆匆。 煅得金珠滚。 珠珠气上冲。 眼前红黄色，华盖要严封。 漏尽池中浊，浮清透蕊降。 直指函文名曰黄轻 第二池炼铅火候法则，与首池相同，仍换新池新鼎，固济如法。 将圣母不动，如有消耗，即添补数足。 进文武火，投水铅半斤，坚固基址。 铅干一半，入圣母在内，大火溶化。 金汁清清明彻底，朱雀恍恍出南园，速进铅珠，勿容火急； 昨夜婴儿初别母，今朝次子亦如前再进铅铢，铢钵如则； 莫道黑龟初出海，也防风浪动人心，铅铅无差，火火一色； 紫金台上凝霜雪，白玉堂前母独眼，策策丙丁升，滴滴铅入骨。 铅数投尽，明镜无尘，退火封门。 进金之铅，二钱三分寒炉一夜，轻轻敲取得鼎上流珠，号曰“黄轻”。 取下另封，移池换鼎。 铜符铁卷 大道总无烦，铅汞两般是。 铅见汞施仁，汞见铅施义。 神丹一味铅，内隐先天气。 媒约丙丁公，调变黄婆力。 搬运赖河车，汞把铅精吸。 浮沉上下间，一一又一一。 华盖日日新，流珠号如意。 黄鹤满空飞，青天雷轰霹。 乾金露紫华，休使铅不及。 但今四门开，上把玄窍闭。 一动铅气通，金池当固密。 这般火烹炼，无形又无质。 直指函文名曰金液 第三池炼铅火候法则，一一与前相同。 将固池，架三足，上坐鼎，封严不动。 圣体无亏，消耗补全。 入筑基池中，大火风开。 三文三武黄芽长，再升再降黑铅功，火火大张，爻爻无易； 黑铅起手无生有，白金倒了有还元，依刻投铅，愈加珍重； 青龙退骨三回转，白虎翻身就地存，进进铅爻，首尾如是； 西池日月初相见，夺得清香各自归，龙霞红似火，真火腾龙霞。 铅数进毕，退火停炉。 入安全之铅，一钱二分。 前三池是长男成象，震庚受符，共用安全之铅七钱，以应天符七日来复之说，以后六池则不用此法矣。

「The First Pool’s Lead Refinement Method: Use one *jin* of pure mountain gold, white as snowflakes, crushed into sixteen pieces.
On days when the sun and moon align in the same wall, when the five stars join in a single pearl, or when *Gan* and *You* (申酉) signify the gold’s vigor, place the pool and cauldron securely, open the wind gate, and introduce the *Wenwu* (文武) fires.
With gentle *Wen* (文) fire warming the pool, first cast in half a *jin* of lead, refining the ash into a solid treasure. Strengthen the foundation to prevent collapse or waste.
When the pool turns red, use nine *hu* of purified *Fuxi* lead (伏气净铅), each *hu* divided into three portions of sixty-five *zhu* (斛/株), each *zhu* as one pool, totaling nine pools with eighty-one *jin* of lead—matching the ninety-nine revolutions of the *Zhou Tian* (周天).
Insert each gold piece into the pool, then apply fierce *Wu* (武) fire to melt them into essence.
Wait only until the blackness fades and the essence reveals itself, appearing and disappearing in two cycles.
The vermilion light flickers half-illuminating the void—auspicious qi rises, floating in purple haze. Gradually add lead, letting it drip until exhausted; then replenish.
As celestial hosts rise and fall in constant motion, the treasure moon and golden flowers burst forth. Again, add lead by the *zhu*.
Do not stray from the center—
When *Gui* (癸) water is fully consumed, the "sea gold" (海金) emerges. Swiftly add lead essence, and *Ren* (壬) water ascends.
A gentle breeze scatters the golden flowers,
Yet the excess reveals *Geng* (庚) as *You* (酉) child.
Use three strong men to assist, taking turns in rotation.
Diet and rest must align with the *Bamen* (八门) openings and closings.
Add lead into the charcoal, boiling and refining with vigor.
Let the *Zhuhu* (朱雀) blaze the void,
While the purple deity’s auspicious qi ascends—
Golden date flowers bloom in crimson flames,
Generating light and essence like lightning.
Do not add lead too hastily—
Haste will prevent the *Jinwu* (金乌) from emerging from the sea.
Nor too slowly—
Slowness risks harming the *Yutu* (玉兔)’s form.
When water and fire intertwine sufficiently, without form or substance, the essence solidifies.
*Ren* water, meeting gold, naturally ascends to the *Nihuan* (泥丸) apex,
Condensing into the "sunlight pearl" (昱日流珠).
After all lead is consumed, withdraw the fire and seal the gate.
Secure the gold and replenish the water,
Then add three *qian* and four *fen* of lead.
Preserve the spirit and stabilize the form—
Do not disturb the pool or cauldron.
Once cooled, remove the *Ren* water from the cauldron,
Called the *Qing’ai* (青埃).
Or seal it in a gold or magnetic box,
Lest the qi escape. Leave it for later generations to blend with their *Yuanpei* (元配).
With bronze seals and iron scrolls,
And comrades of shared intent, guard the *Ziyang* (紫阳) Palace.
Black becomes red as the elixir,
Red becomes black as the *Weng* (翁).
The harmony of heaven and earth’s marrow—
This alone is the Dao of the elixir.
At the *Yumen* (禹门), draw three waves of water,
Letting droplets fall into the void.
On the palace’s summit, pearls roll like sunlight—
Their hue resembles purple-gold and crimson.
Within the pool, jade nectar churns,
Blown by the *Xun* (巽) wind.
The *Yutu* (玉兔) resides in *You* (酉),
The *Jinwu* (金乌) ascends to the east.
Dragon and tiger gaze from afar,
Uniting in the *Jingyang* (景阳) Palace.
Extract the lead’s treasure,
Do not rush the fire’s timing.
Calcined, the golden pearls roll—
Each pearl’s qi surges upward.
Before your eyes, red and yellow appear,
Seal the *Huagai* (華蓋) tightly.
When the lead’s impurities are exhausted,
The pool’s clarity rises, and pure essence descends.
Directly pointing to the *Hunwen*—
Named *Huangqing* (黄轻).

The Second Pool’s Lead Refinement Method follows the same principles,
But use a new pool and new cauldron, securing it as before.
Keep the *Shengmu* (圣母) unshaken—
If there’s any loss, replenish it fully.
Introduce the *Wenwu* fires,
Cast in half a *jin* of water-lead.
Strengthen the foundation.
Half the lead is consumed,
And the *Shengmu* is within.
Apply fierce fire to melt it—
The golden essence becomes clear and bright,
The *Zhuhu* (朱雀) emerges from the southern garden.
Swiftly add lead essence,
Do not let the fire rage too fiercely;
Last night’s child just parted from its mother,
Today’s younger sibling follows the same.
Add lead by the *zhu* and *bu*—
No distinction between black tortoise and lead,
Nor between flames of varied hues;
On the purple-gold platform, frost condenses,
Before the white jade hall, the mother gazes with one eye.
*Bingding* (丙丁) ascends in measured strides,
Lead drips into the bones.
After all lead is consumed,
The mirror remains pristine and dust-free.
Withdraw the fire and seal the gate.
Add the "secure lead" (安全之铅) of two *qian* and three *fen*,
Boiled in a cold furnace overnight.
Gently tap to retrieve the pearls rolling on the cauldron’s surface,
Called the *Huangqing* (黄轻).
Seal them separately, then shift to a new pool and cauldron.

With bronze seals and iron scrolls,
The Great Dao is without complication—
Lead and mercury are two kinds.
Lead treats mercury with kindness,
Mercury treats lead with righteousness.
The divine elixir is one flavor of lead,
Holding within it the *Xiantian* (先天) qi.
The *Bingding* (丙丁) partners mediate,
Transforming the *Huangpo* (黄婆) power.
Transport relies on the *Hechē* (河车),
Mercury absorbing lead’s essence.
In rising and falling,
One follows the other.
The *Huagai* (華蓋) renews daily,
Pearls are called "as one wishes" (如意).
Yellow cranes fill the sky in flight,
Green heavens crackle with thunder.
*Qianjin* (乾金) reveals purple brilliance,
Do not let lead fall short.
Now, open the four gates,
Seal above the *Xuanqiao* (玄窍).
Disturb the lead’s qi,
And the golden pool must be sealed tight.
Such is the fire’s alchemy—

Eastward, the Sun’s crystal emerges,
Its radiance dazzling and bright.
Illuminating all under heaven,
Its dew enters the jade city’s waves.

Day and night it turns east and west,
Setting in the west, rising again in the east.
The Great Mother of the Sun opens and closes,
All things receive its luminous essence.

The marrow of Heaven and Earth—
The root of the Dao of Immortal Elixir.

In the *Kūn* (坤) month, as the moon wanes,
Darkness deepens, embodying the *Tàiyīn* (太阴).
A faint star glimmers in the southwest,
While the Sun traverses the eastern land,
The Moon gradually moves southward.

By the seventh and eighth days, its light floats within,
Gradually filling a *hú* (斛) measure.
Half black, half white—
The white is the essence of gold.

Without the power of the *Sānjiǎo* (三足), the Moon’s brilliance would not arise.
At the fifteenth day, over *Jiǎdì* (甲地),
The elixir’s light fills the Jade Capital.

Directly pointing to *Hánwén* (函文), it is called **"Hóngxiá" (红霞)**.

The fourth pool’s lead and fire regimen
Follows the same as before.

Do not disturb the Sacred Embryo;
Wait for the Mother to enter the pool,
Then ignite the Great Fire with wind.

Proceed with lead as before—
No *xùntǒng* (荀筒) may be used.
Three days, three fusions yield True Lead—
Only when yin and yang are resolved does it emerge.

Again, advance the lead *yáo* (爻),
Each step continuous.

The Golden Elixir relies on *Gēngxīn* (庚辛) power—
Without *Rén*, *Gēng* cannot form; without *Guǐ* (癸), it cannot separate.

Observe the lead and *rénshuǐ*—
Their interplay refines the white gold.
When metal and water unite,
Common sons become sacred descendants.

The Mother melts in the Hua Pool—
Each must be distinctly observed.
Five-colored radiance arises,
Enveloping it in crimson mist.

Hour by hour, scenes gleam like gold and jade,
Day by day, the flowers bloom anew in form.

Begin only with silver and lead,
Dispersing lead and mercury,
Exhausting every *tǔzhū* (土铢),
Leaving the furnace cold through the night.
Extract the *rénshuǐ* from the crucible—
Called **"Hóngxiá" (红霞)**—record it, replace the pool, and refine anew.

**Copper Talisman, Iron Scrolls**
Black lead is Heaven’s essence,
White gold is Earth’s fluid.
Black hides within water, bearing yang;
White holds fire’s qi.

Black and white alternate, returning to their proper places.
Their natures intertwine—
The *Dānjīng* (丹经) calls them kindred.

Black submits to white as master,
Yin pairs with yang as consort.
When yin and yang merge in chaos,
Petals of gold bloom emerald-green.

The Treasure Moon fills the *Dāntián* (丹田),
Boiling fiercely in the crucible’s heat.
Do not seal—open the Heavenly Aperture,
Let it breathe in and out.
In the midst of churning—
The tortoise hides itself.

The secret incantation’s marvel,
The fire’s measure lies in its signs.

Nurturing the Sacred Descendant within the common—
All else is but this singular treasure.

**A Daily Birth of Sons**
Each day a son is born—
Each son dwells in his own chamber.

*"Direct-Pointing Scroll"*—named *Liújīn* (流金)
The fifth pool’s lead-refining fire:
Harvesting the pool’s cauldron—
Each step identical.

The Holy Mother enters the pool,
Wind opens the golden elixir.
Cast lead as before,
Ever add charcoal within.

The Golden Sage, refined a hundred times, grows in spirit—
Only true lead ascends and descends.

Again, lead beads advance,
Yellow and white merge in chaos.
Boiling with talisman-fire, the Three Yang circulate,
Nine nines—pearls flow, the Mother-Yin departs.

Recognize lead and gold—
Neither yellow nor purple.

The sun-soul enters Chang’e’s hall,
Seeking mid-autumn’s fragrant blossom.
Lead exhausted, *Rén* ascends—
*Xīn* gold reveals itself.

From the cold pool, it’s taken—
Named *"Liújīn"*—stored for another refining.

**Copper Talisman, Iron Scrolls**
One true essence is gathered—
The *Dantai* Mother shifts to Yin.

One Mother bears six sons,
The *Fúshāng* sun now shines.
Each pool mirrors its beginning,
Each cauldron grows stranger and new.

Ascending to the Crimson Silk realm,
Each grain of *qi* rises pure and clear.
Do not let lead bury mercury—
False claims of lingering *qi* are deceit.

The *Xùn* wind rages—
*Liújīn* permeates the body, luminous.
Not rigid or harsh in nature—
From here, the Yellow Vehicle is born.

*Guǐ* submits to *Rén* as master,
*Rén* to *Guǐ* as guest.
All follows the Great Dao’s law—
*Rén* and *Guǐ* determine floating and sinking.
Discard the turbid below,
Light and pure—spirit ever refined.
Such floating-sinking methods—
Unmatched in the world.

Fire’s suffusion is complete—
Each grain of Heaven’s rice turns azure-green.

*"Direct-Pointing Scroll"*—named *Rénhuā* (壬华)
The sixth pool’s lead-refining fire:
Weighing and measures—
All follows the same great principle.
Divide the lead by measure—
No need for old tricks;
Transformation lies in human action.
After refining two or three pools,
Its marvels arise naturally.

If pearls flow sparingly, the Spirit-Fire does not rise.
If refining is incomplete, the numinous does not appear.
Kindle the embryo-fire,
Let yellow clouds fill the marsh.
Yin reaches its peak—yang is born,
Upper and lower gates open.
Fine light flashes—
Dew drips upon the Yellow Court.
The infant manifests—
Light follows spirit’s birth.
Lead reaches the crown—
Order it to spread in all directions,
For proper function.
Only when nourishment is full
Should one approach the furnace—
Evil *qi* cannot enter.

Lead exhausted, withdraw the fire,
Take the *Rén* water from the cauldron’s top—
Named *"Rénhuā"*—stored for another refining.

**Copper Talisman, Iron Scrolls**
The Primordial Dao’s root,
The Jade-Purity’s single gate.
Beyond this method, none are true.
Refine the lead’s treasure within,
Extract the silver’s essence—
Flooded waters stall the wheel,
Not as perilous as harming gold.
Pearls drift in ceaseless flow,
Mysterious auspicious *qi* ascends.
Child and Mother regard each other,
Yellow and white devour in confusion.
Dazed, emotions stir—
Threefold, ninefold cities.
Pure white reveals the treasure,
Azure-green departs from Yin.
Washed free of lead and mercury’s bones,
Naturally the essence crystallizes.
Lotus blooms in murky water,
Waves surge in endless teeming.
Beyond true lead and mercury,
No heed to external sounds.
The Iron Scroll’s intent,
The Dan-Door listens closely.

*"Direct-Pointing Scroll"*—named *Rénhuā* (壬花)
The seventh pool’s lead-refining fire—same as before.
Martial fire dissolves the Holy Mother,
Awaiting crimson light to enfold the Treasure Moon—
Then introduce each grain of lead.
Permeating the body, crimson jade,
Internally and externally pure white—
Gold is born after lead,
Yang produced within lead.
Fire consumes gold,
Gold subdues wood—flourishes.
Blue, red, black, white—
All return to central yellow.
Follow their signs,
Observe the phenomena.
Each pool scatters purple dust,
Each fire ignites its pattern-light.
Piercing the *Huàgài* canopy,
The chamber fills with luminous dust.
Ten thousand *li* without clouds—
Heaven in one hue.
Twelve hours reveal the sun.
Yellow Vehicle, purple dust—
All arise from here.
White snow, green ash—
Those who see it prosper.

Originally, one essence of lead-precision,
With white gold separating Yin-earth.
Gold is water’s foundation,
Water is the Dao’s pivot.
Only these two substances—
True cinnabar, true mercury—
All from silver and lead.
Formless yet symbolic,
Dark yet luminous.
Lead exhausted in the cold furnace,
Collect the *Rén* water from the cauldron’s top—
Named *"Rénhuā"*—transferred to another pool.

**Copper Talisman, Iron Scrolls**
*Bùqì* breathes life’s essence,
Containing light before Heaven and Earth.
Its root sprouts from the floating soil,
Its sprout grows in the Great Red Sky.
Eight treasures stem from this,
Only the luminous lead is black.
Now knowing Heaven and Earth’s secret—
Refining this is fertile ground.
Six Yin forge the Holy Body,
Gnarled bones return to the Yellow Springs.
The method points with mind to mind,
Mechanisms researched in detail.
Without true transmission,
All effort is in vain.
Futilely advancing Heaven’s fire,
How could the fragile endure?
Hard and soft have exterior and interior,
Yin and Yang follow Nature’s decree.
Within the cauldron—Heaven in Earth,
In the pool—Earth beneath Heaven.
Pure white on the Jade Terrace,
Substance as clean as silk.
The Mother cradles seven or eight sons,
Spirit ever more refined than before.
The Perfected One receives the transmission—
A worthy cause, a destined fate.
If you know to exchange bones,
Nánchāng leaves you to your leisure.

*"Direct-Pointing Scroll"*—named *Zǐjīnliú* (紫金硫)
The eighth pool’s fire and cauldron—
Both renewed.
Nine *liǎng* of lead, eight *liǎng* of foundation,
Refined as before.
Now the technique is pure—
Knowing ascent and descent,
Excess and deficiency, each in measure.
If pearls flow sparingly, seek the Dry Father,
*Xīn* gold’s loss is supplemented.
Gold flowers are the pool’s medicine—
Harvesting *Jīnhuā* requires no more words.
One method divides lead’s *Rén* and *Guǐ*,
One method washes gold’s turbid Yin.
Each time lead is the medicine,
Extracting medicine is extracting lead.
Understanding lead’s purpose—
The elixir’s spirit is not lead.
Like sun and moon exchanging light,
Steal only its spirit,
Not its form.
Using spirit, discarding form—
Thus attaining longevity.

Lead exhausted, take the *Rén* water from the cauldron’s top—
Named *"Zǐjīnliú"*—refined in another pool.

chunks.original_text: 黑取黑之髓，白取白之油。 黑白共合体，油髓自然稠。 婴儿入紫府，姹女下重楼。 煤灼中黄宝，修就紫金硫。 下布长蛇阵，驾凤在碧游。 瑶池初浴体，未济养三周。 擒住南朱雀，真土葬为丘。 火候同一二，法则似前求。 三壬癸一两，九阳足以收。 九九八十一，不足照前抽。 夺尽九六数，西山鬼哭愁。 逆顺颠倒理，为尾又为头。 直指函文名曰妙灵砂 第九池火候法则，炼铅亦同。 入圣母在内溶化，红光笼罩宝月，方进铅钵。 水银过度，神仙至秘。 招摄龙精，赖于虎髓。 不用铅形，只有铅气。 铅气何得，先求同类。 同类是金，灰池用意。 阵阵火功，外包鼎器。 流珠得金分出，不与世铅相同。 见火则别，见金又住。 从一至九，谓之炼已，是炼精化气之功。 一池至九池，壬水各自封固。 圣水多备，以防后用。 所谓得药忘年，炼铅无计，乃活法也。 寒炉开看，母体白如雪片方好，号曰“妙灵砂”。 如青黄，非铅之真气，乃癸水未尽，必须猛烹极煅，浪涌波翻，方怀真气。 后有温养赤文之诀，返魂换骨之功。 详者如右（下）。 人元九鼎秘诀 一鼎 人元一鼎丹，九九过铅关。 复用青都所，返出又回还。 辛金浑似雪，壬水化为烟。 子母平平入，五五育天色。 霹雳三周火，分胎上下间。 莫此尘嚣事，笃志要心坚。 一阳初复日，神魂一线缠。 亲授铅符卷，铅汞自留连。 诀曰：九炼辛金一斤碎为米粒，将首池青埃一斤，二物混合。 入阴阳鼎内，神胶封固，铁线十字扎住，外用泥包固，入未济炉，三足上稳定，勿使偏歪颠倒，周围上下，净灰盖之。 加顶火四两养一七，二七火六两，三七火半斤，温养二十五日。 取出入明炉，先文后武，煅炼六六三十六时，鼎火一色，日足冷定。 开鼎取看，变成红霞，在上成质，如赤玉紫粉。 辛金在下成一饼，外白内黄。 再又过度，中乘一月一鼎，祖气初传，乍离母体。 神气混沌，魂魄不坚，不堪点化。 再寻乳母，意志超越。 为出类拔萃之神符，有起死回生之功力。 二鼎 人元二鼎丹，耀出禹门关。 复用希夷所，夜落晓归还。 日魂霞里见，月魄满秋天。 兄弟平平入，五五赤文全。 三十六时火，分开一二三。 一子嚣浮骨，二子志方坚。 二阳来复后，开如鸡子颜。 亲授铜符卷，银铅鼎炭钳。 诀曰：前圣金一斤，至此丝毫不折，不可伤动胎根。 将一鼎青汞，配二池流珠，共二斤拌匀。 与胎上下，铺盖固济。 火候同前，温养日足。 武火分胎，天地人三才定位。 首子青汞如灰，虚嚣则无神气。 二子似水晶黄芽，渐长成抽出尘嚣，谓之真铅。 将此作长生匮，青汞三钱，伏光明砂一两，再加丙火三日。 气绝形黄，将砂一钱，于干汞一两。 以汞一钱化铜十两。 如此神异变化无方，是宗祖之初功也。 三鼎 人元三鼎丹，飞出斗牛关。 复用混沌所，牵转白牛还。 金鹅飞去窟，赤凤伏丹田。 生熟平平入，宗祖出黄泉。 六六时中火。 江流动动潺。 一二翠如玉，两长力难坚。 三阳来复后，开之碧芷莲。 铜符铁卷旨，梧桐宿凤鸾。 诀曰：前圣金一斤，将二鼎流珠配三池金液，共二斤拌匀。 与圣母上下铺盖固济，手法如前。 文火温养，子母熏蒸。 武火煅炼，返魂换骨。 日足周全，一进一出。 留少去老，二子不用。

Divine secret of immortals.

Relying on tiger marrow.

First seek its kindred.
Kindred is gold—
Gray Pool’s intent.

Layered firecraft,
Externally encasing the cauldron.
Pearls yield gold’s portion—
Not like worldly lead.

Gold reveals its stillness.
From One to Nine—

One Pool to Nine Pool—
Each *Rén* water sealed apart.
Holy waters stored abundantly,
For later use.

Cold furnace opened—
Mother’s body white as snowflakes—

Not true lead *qi*—
*Guǐ* water yet exhausted.

Waves surging, billowing—

Will transcending.

Five fives complete *Chìwén*.

Mix with second Pool’s pearls—

Layer above and below the embryo,

Fire as before, nurture fully by day.

Second child unused.

The *Rén* essence of the Eight Cauldrons elixir,

Red *liúlí* and crimson amber—
From seven returns and nine renewals,
Refining *qi* to divine essence.

Yellow gold as the master medicine.
True mercury of this world,
Used as the progenitor for ascending elixirs.

Then cook it into golden chestnuts,
And announce to the Highest Emperor of Heaven and Earth,
Choosing a day to bathe in purity,
Facing east at dawn and dusk.

Naturally harmonizing with divine *qi* and spirit,

By this stage of elixir cultivation,

Revealing its three colors and four forms of divine medicines.

Cauldrons radiate brilliance.

Build a hall of rites,

Upper and lower double crucibles,

All planted within the secret range of the divine elixir.
In the Eastern Jin, Emperor Wu practiced the Way of Properness (*Dàozhèngxíng*),
And thus the *Qīnmǔ* (elixir mother) emerged,
The True Lord bestowed it upon *Wú Měng*,
Who passed it to *Xiè Qiān* and *Shèng*,

The **Heavenly Primordial Secret Formula**

The divine elixir, the great medicine,
Must be sought in gold and earth.

Bright dust passes through the chinks,
All drawing from the *Lí* talisman.

Eighty-one *Qián* talismans,
Seventy-two *Kūn* strategies.

Eight measures of water to eight measures of gold,
How could they be deficient?

Half pure, half turbid,
Clouds and mists naturally unite.

A single drop of gold yields clarity,
A single talisman of fire brings brilliance,
The oral formula must be precise,
And the technique flawless in execution.

Lean upon the balance of the Tiger,
And submit to the standard of the Nine Dragons.

Thus embodying the *Qián* and *Kūn* forms,
Thus displaying the radiance of the Sun and Moon.

The *Xīyí* and *Hébì* [1] manifest,
And all phenomena appear in attendance.

Refinement follows strict measures,
Every grain must adhere to the law.

Prepare the ritual implements within the hall,
And first arrange the basin and crucible to left and right.

A true friend attends with devotion,
Loyal, upright, gentle, and kind.

Before constructing the divine chamber, return to the golden crucible,
And first visit worthy companions to lay the sacred foundation.

The Dragon and Tiger bow in reverence,
The Tortoise and Serpent lie in wait.

Following the mysterious techniques,
There is never a single failure.

Maintain unwavering sincerity,
And remain steadfast without deviation.

Why need the Celestial Golden Crow descend?
Why not seize the Jade Hare from mortal realms?

Refine the floating *Lí* [2] into true earth,
And produce the wish-fulfilling gem.

Swallow one grain to ascend the heavens in radiance.
Before attaining the boundless virtue of the *Yīn* [3],
At the moment of refining, no need for concern.

I shall now reveal my threefold method,
With no word concealed—bestow it upon you.

Nurture the Dao’s root from early days,
And it will naturally manifest in time.

Do not speak lightly of heavenly secrets,
Nor let the unworthy mock its form.

**Water and Fire Principles**
The elixir’s fire must be the **Five Convergences’ True Fire** [4].
Not common flame.

True fire relies on the sun’s essence;
The Yellow Emperor took fire with the *Yángyǐng* mirror [5],
While the *Yīnyǐng* mirror is hard to obtain,
And red gold can also draw fire from sunlight.

In essence, the sun is heaven’s true fire,
Its vitality self-sustaining, its radiance self-revealing.
Each day is so, each month likewise—
If fire is taken by chiseling wood or stone,
Its nature is harsh and violent,
Not in accord with nature’s intent.

Better to wait until noon, when fire is at its peak,
And use a fire mirror to draw it from the sun.

Borrowing the sun’s fire is also called **True Fire**,
Hence the term **"Sun-Soul"** (*Rìhún*)* [6],
To symbolize true mercury (*Zhēnggǒng*)* [7],
And as the true seed,
Sufficient for the elixir’s divine purpose—
Why cling rigidly to the *Yángyǐng* mirror?

Water must be drawn from the **Square Pearl** (*Fāngzhū*)* [8].
The Square Pearl is the moon’s luminous essence ascending,
Condensing into shape within water—pure *Yīn*.

On the fifteenth night of the eighth month,
Between the hours of *Hài* and *Zǐ* [9],
When the moon’s brilliance is at its height, take it.

Beyond the Mid-Autumn Festival,
No other month suffices.

If virtue and conduct are incomplete,
And *Yīn* deeds are insufficient,
Or one has not yet practiced sincerity toward heaven,
Then many cloudy, rainy days will arise—
Where will the water come from?

Even if true water is obtained,
A single night’s harvest—
How much could it yield?

To cultivate the void, there is no divine medicine—
Fire lies below, water is diminished.
Each day and night,
Refill and adjust, using ten *jīn* of water,
A year requires over two thousand five hundred *jīn*.

Yet Mid-Autumn yields only two hours—
How could it suffice for two thousand five hundred *jīn*?

Without this water,
The pairing of Sun-Soul and Moon-Soul is incomplete,
And heaven’s water and fire are misaligned.
If common water is used,
It is not the true seed—
The student is at a dead end.
Would that not be a mistake?

Now I open the door of convenience,
And reveal the path to heavenly ascent.

Water indeed is the moon’s *Yīn* essence,
Heaven’s **One Primordial’s Divine Water** (*Tiānyīshénshuǐ*)* [10],
Flowing and condensing from the **Divine Dragon** (*Shénlóng*)* [11].

Each year, in the pure *Yáng* month of the fourth,
When the Divine Dragon transforms,
Its water holds power.

When heavy rains fall, collect them in magnetic vessels,
Cover tightly, lest dust fall—
Thus securing the year’s supply.

There is no month without rain at all,
This too is the adept’s wondrous adaptability—
Why cling rigidly to the Square Pearl?

**Earthly Veins Principles**
To refine the elixir, choose a sacred mountain,
A blessed land of towering peaks and encircling winds;
Sit facing south, toward noon,
So the Golden Crow and Jade Hare
Rise in the east and set in the west,
Turning left and right in their cycles.

Lakes and marshes must be pristine,
Bamboo and trees must be pure and strange.
Dragons coil in layers beside the hall,
Tigers’ wings stack in tiers within the divine chamber;
The **Black Tortoise** (*Xuánwǔ*)* [12] hides behind the screen,
The **Vermilion Bird** (*Zhūquè*)* [13] strides in orderly ranks.

Avoid the passage of dust and vulgarity,
Sever ties with ordinary friends;
Cultivate the realm of the **Island of Immortality** (*Qióngdǎo*)* [14],
And shun the filth of mortal remains.

Observe the celestial waters above,
And examine the earthly veins below.
